citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The written program of veterinary care is not yet available, as it is still with the attending veterinarian for updating.
Without veterinary guidance, animals may not receive optimal care. Applicant shall assure that the attending veterinarian
has appropriate authority to ensure the provision of adequate veterinary care. Applicant shall develop and maintain, with
the attending veterinarian, a written program of veterinary care and regularly scheduled visits to the premises.
Remains Uncorrected

Hair and dust has been mostly removed from the enclosures in the fox room. However, areas of rust has been exposed
on some of the enclosures. Rust prevents effective cleaning and may harbor disease agents. Enclosures, litter trays, and
housing facilities shall be cleaned as often as necessary, including the elimination of rust, to minimize disease hazards
and reduce odors.
Remains Uncorrected

The animals are housed in rooms of the applicants' primary residence. The rooms remain overcrowded with stored items.
Stored items include donated animal food, beeding, & other supplies, personal items, and a clothes dryer which is not in
use, to name a few. Stored items are stacked, nearly to the ceiling in some areas, creating paths through the home to
access the animals. There is minimal clearance to work with and access the animals, clean enclosures and housing
rooms, as well as provide repair to and maintain enclosures. Optimal animal welfare is hindered in such cramped
quarters. Premises shall be kept clean and in good repair to protect the the animals from injury and to facilitate
prescribed husbandry practices.
Remains Uncorrected
This is a 1st re-license inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicants.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections by March 13, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next re-license inspection.
Your previous USDA license has expired, no regulated activity may be conducted until a re-license inspection is passed.
End Section
